title: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev
summary: Dzhokhar Anzorovich Tsarnaev (/ˌdʒoʊˈxɑːr ˌtsɑːrˈnaɪɛf/; born July 22, 1993)[note 1] is a Kyrgyz-American terrorist of Chechen descent[9] who was convicted of perpetrating the Boston Marathon bombing by planting pressure cooker bombs near the finish line of the race on April 15, 2013, along with his brother Tamerlan Tsarnaev.[10][11][12][13] The bombings killed three people and injured approximately 280 others.[14]
